channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @DainyBernstein @scalzi You don’t need a hundred percent conversion ratio to prosper. Arguably Ayn Rand was the most influential Jewish philosopher/theologian of the mid 20th century.
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein @scalzi You don’t need a hundred percent conversion ratio to prosper. Arguably Ayn Rand was the most influential Jewish philosopher/theologian of the mid 20th century.

item.description: @DainyBernstein @scalzi But it worked. You picked it up. Very strongly considering an essay contest on the Hebrew Priestess.
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein @scalzi But it worked. You picked it up. Very strongly considering an essay contest on the Hebrew Priestess.

item.description: @DainyBernstein So you might be particularly amused -- or not -- by this excerpt of a book categorization taxonomy I used for my books. https://t.co/rdMnJemceI
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein So you might be particularly amused -- or not -- by this excerpt of a book categorization taxonomy I used for my books. https://t.co/rdMnJemceI

item.description: @DainyBernstein Ah, you mean the Print Interregnum.
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein Ah, you mean the Print Interregnum.

item.description: @JewishWonk I say it’s Tishrei erasure. And thus a very good thing, certainly during Av.

item.description: Glad to see Britain reentering the Mideast colonial game. Why should Americans have all the fun with their desert hummus? https://t.co/smrK9qg1VT
item.source:markdown: Glad to see Britain reentering the Mideast colonial game. Why should Americans have all the fun with their desert hummus? https://t.co/smrK9qg1VT

item.description: @WendellSherk @Bamer1can @AkivaMCohen I think the judge knew he was writing for the broad political argument. Note that having demolished the constitutionality of the law, he gave a graphic example of its malign stupidity on the very last page.
item.source:markdown: @WendellSherk @Bamer1can @AkivaMCohen I think the judge knew he was writing for the broad political argument. Note that having demolished the constitutionality of the law, he gave a graphic example of its malign stupidity on the very last page.

item.description:
A delightful federal court ruling, which along the way points out the danger Republican anti-“woke” activism, as embodied by the unconstitutional DeSantis law at issue, is bad for Holocaust education. https://t.co/Zd7q5pTxEp

Also warns that Finnegan’s Wake is unconstitutionally vague.
item.source:markdown:
A delightful federal court ruling, which along the way points out the danger Republican anti-“woke” activism, as embodied by the unconstitutional DeSantis law at issue, is bad for Holocaust education. https://t.co/Zd7q5pTxEp
Also warns that Finnegan’s Wake is unconstitutionally vague.

item.description: @AkivaMCohen A delightful read. Is this the first time that Joyce has been declared unconstitutionally vague?
item.source:markdown: @AkivaMCohen A delightful read. Is this the first time that Joyce has been declared unconstitutionally vague?

item.description: What other army would arrest a human rights worker to ensure Jews could worship freely (on someone else’s land) on Tisha b’Av? מי כעמך ישראל! https://t.co/GuSdGs8bAL
